## Cost of Debt (CAPM vs Default Method)

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 6.5, sd = 0.01)
yield <- rnorm(1, mean = 10, sd = 0.01)
mrp <- rnorm(1, mean = 8, sd = 0.01)
loss<- rnorm(1, mean = 7, sd = 0.01)
default <- rnorm(1, mean = 50, sd = 0.01)
beta <- 0.15
```

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkNumericAnswer('module4_num_q2a')" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q2a"><strong>1. Estimate the debt's expected return using CAPM. Yield = `r round(yield,2)`%, Beta = `r round(beta,2)`, Risk-free rate = `r round(rf,2)`%, Market Risk Premium = `r round(mrp,2)`%.</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q2a" name="module4_num_q2a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round(rf + beta * mrp,2)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q2a" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Expected Return (CAPM) = r_f + β × MRP = **`r round(rf + beta * mrp,2)`**%.
</div>

:::

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkNumericAnswer('module4_num_q2b')" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q2b"><strong>2. Estimate the debt's expected return using Default Rate method (Default Prob = `r round(default,2)`%, Loss Rate = `r round(loss,2)`%).</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q2b" name="module4_num_q2b" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round(yield - default/100 * loss,2)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q2b" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Expected Return (Default Method) = Yield - Default × Loss = **`r round(yield - default/100 * loss,2)`**%.
</div>

:::
